channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Calida: NTC cannot grant ABS-CBN provisional authority despite lawmakers' requests
item.description: "These issuances cannot amend the current law requiring a congressional franchise for the operation of broadcasting networks," Calida said.

item.title: PhilHealth premium hike during pandemic insensitive, OFWs say
item.description: The PhilHealth memo treats OFWs like "mere milking cows for government funds," Gabriela UAE said.

item.title: COVID-19 cases breach 9,000 as DOH records 295 additional patients
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: With the department’s latest tally, the number of active cases in the country stands at 7,402.

item.title: Drilon: Targeting Taiwan OFW over social media posts not labor official's job
item.description: Asked about Macauyag’s actions against the Filipina, Drilon said: “For me, this labor attaché in Taiwan violated all norms of decency when he said that this fellow Filipino of ours should be deported."

item.title: On World Press Freedom Day, PCOO urges public to fight 'fake news'
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Press freedom, PCOO said, also helped voice out the public's pulse and enabled the government to increase public awareness of its policies and to report its activities with "complete transparency."

item.title: On World Press Freedom Day, groups wary of shrinking space for fundamental freedoms
item.description: "As in years past, we observe World Press Freedom Day more for the lack than the reality," NUJP said.

item.title: DILG optimistic Metro Manila will 'graduate' to GCQ on May 15
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "It looks like Metro Manila will graduate on May 15. But of course, that's still a while away. By all indications by May 15, GCQ tayo, and our people can go back to work. If that happens, we'll have kickstarted the economy already."

item.title: POGOs 'very essential' to the government — Bato
item.description: “They’re saying they can make a big contribution to the government’s war chest in the fight against COVID; if they can operate, that will be a big help to the government,” Dela Rosa said in Filipino.

item.title: Reinventing arts and culture during COVID-19
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: With mass gatherings prohibited due to the coronavirus disease 2019, the arts and culture sector is looking at ways to reinvent itself to a “new normal” in the post-pandemic recovery period.

item.title: SC decision on Cebu exams paves way for Bar regionalization
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The regionalization of the Bar exams for 2021 is a dream come true for former University of Cebu-College of Law dean Baldomero Estenzo, who has pushed for it for more than a decade.
